subject: Leadership
title: Belbin Team Roles
description: A 60-second lesson on Belbin Team Roles.

hook.text: A team of nine brilliant strategists can't execute anything. Another with mixed skills delivers every time.

buildup.text: Belbin identified nine team roles: Plant, Monitor, Coordinator, Shaper, Implementer, Finisher, and three more.

discovery.text: Balanced teams outperform uniform ones. You need thinkers and doers, creators and finishers, leaders and helpers.

twist.text: People can fill multiple roles, and roles shift by project. The key is awareness, not rigid assignment.

climax.text: Leaders use Belbin to diagnose gaps. If everyone is a visionary and nobody finishes, you've found the bottleneck.

punchline.text: Great teams aren't great individuals. They're great combinations.

quiz.question: What is the main insight from Belbin's team roles?
options: Every team needs exactly nine members
Only leaders need to know their role
